org.xchain.framework.net

Class DependencyTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.net.DependencyTracker

  • public class DependencyTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    DependencyTracker is used to track dependencies. Dependency tracking is thread safe, but a thread can only track dependencies for a single entity at a time. Dependency tracking is started with the startTracking() method. Dependencies will be registered with dependencyFound() or dependencySetFound methods or when a URI is resolved with a wrapped URIResolver. Wrapped URIResolvers are created with the createDependencyUriResolver() method. Dependency tracking is stopped with the stopTracking() method. This method will return a set of URLs which are the tracked dependencies.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Devon Tackett, Josh Kennedy

      • createDependencyUriResolver

        public javax.xml.transform.URIResolver createDependencyUriResolver(javax.xml.transform.URIResolver uriResolver)
        Create a wrapped URIResolver for dependency tracking. Any URLs resolved through the returned URIResolve will be considered dependencies while tracking is on.
        Parameters:
        uriResolver - The original URI resolver to wrap.
        Returns:
        The wrapped URI resolver.
